instructions.title: Instructions
instructions.subtitle: Set up App Geocercas from zero to gain real control of personnel, activities and costs using geofences.
instructions.tocSubtitle: Navigate through the steps and apply the guide in your organization.
instructions.stepsSubtitle: Follow the suggested order to get quick results.
instructions.recommendationBody: Complete steps 1 to 5 first. Then connect the Tracker and review reports.
instructions.bestPractice1Body: Use clear, repeatable names for geofences, personnel and activities. This improves reports and avoids confusion.
instructions.bestPractice2Body: Avoid huge polygons. A precise area produces more reliable entries/exits.
instructions.bestPractice3Body: Define hourly rate and currency from the start so the cost dashboard makes sense.
instructions.bestPractice4Body: Make sure location permissions are enabled to avoid incomplete logs.
instructions.resultIntro: After completing the guide, you will have:
resultBullets: Hours and costs calculated without manual reports.
Reliable reports by person, activity and geofence.
A solid base for audits, control and decision making.

steps.title: Step 1: Create your organization
bullets: The organization is the main container for all your information.
Define who is Owner (full control) and who will be Administrators.
Everything you create (geofences, personnel, reports) stays within the organization.

steps.title: Step 2: Create geofences
bullets: Create real work zones: fields, job sites, safety areas, etc.
Recommendation: polygons adjusted to the real area (avoid giant geofences).
Use clear names: “Field 3 – Harvest”, “Warehouse”, “Main entrance”…

steps.title: Step 3: Register personnel
bullets: Admins: manage data, view reports and costs.
Trackers: use the phone to log location (they don’t see admin modules).
Keep names consistent for reporting (e.g., Lastname + Firstname).

steps.title: Step 4: Create activities
bullets: Activities represent the type of work: Harvest, Irrigation, Maintenance, Security…
Set hourly rate and currency for automatic cost calculation.
Add a description so the whole team understands it the same way.

steps.title: Step 5: Create assignments
bullets: An assignment links: Person + Activity + Geofence.
When the tracker enters/exits a geofence, time is recorded and duration is calculated.
This removes manual reports and reduces errors.

steps.title: Step 6: Use the Tracker (mobile)
bullets: Allow location permissions (ideally background) for consistent logs.
Works offline: stores data and syncs when the connection returns.
Optimize battery: use reasonable intervals and avoid apps that kill background processes.

steps.title: Step 7: View reports and costs
bullets: Consult reports by person, activity, geofence and date range.
Verify hours and costs calculated automatically.
Export/use reports for internal control, audits or billing.

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.subtitle: Quick answers about organizations, geofences, tracker, costs and permissions.

items.a: It is the main container of data in App Geocercas. Inside an organization you store geofences, personnel, activities, assignments, reports and costs. Each organization is isolated (multi-tenant).

items.q: What is the difference between Owner, Admin and Tracker?
items.a: Owner: full control of the organization, can manage everything and invite users. Admin: manages administrative modules according to permissions. Tracker: uses the app to send location; does not manage administrative data.

items.q: Can I have more than one organization with the same user?
items.a: Yes. The system supports multi-organization. Your active organization defines what data you see and which permissions apply at that moment.

items.q: What types of geofences can I use?
items.a: You can work with polygon zones (recommended for real areas) and radius/center zones (useful for specific points).

items.q: Why does my geofence not mark entries/exits as expected?
items.a: Common causes: geofence too large, low GPS accuracy, very long logging intervals, or limited location permissions. Adjust the polygon and check tracker permissions.

items.q: How many geofences can I create?
items.a: It depends on the plan. On the free plan, keep a reasonable number for performance. PRO plans enable more geofences and advanced tools.
Yes. The tracker can store logs locally when there is no signal and sync when the connection returns.
It depends on the logging frequency and device. Recommendation: use reasonable intervals, allow background location, and disable aggressive battery optimizations for the app.

items.q: Which permissions should I enable on mobile?
items.a: Precise location and, if possible, background location. Without these permissions, logs can be incomplete or intermittent.
Based on tracker logs (entries/exits or stays in geofences) and active assignments: Person + Activity + Geofence.
Each activity can have an hourly rate and currency. The system multiplies recorded hours by the rate and generates reports and dashboards.
Yes. You can define activities with currency and see summaries by currency in reports/dashboard (depending on module configuration).

items.q: Who can see a tracker’s location?
items.a: Only users with permissions within the same organization (owner/admin) through the corresponding module. Data is isolated by organization.
No. The tracker role is designed for field operation and should not access reports/costs/administration.

items.q: Will there be a PRO plan?
items.a: Yes. PRO aims to enable more geofences, more reports, automations, priority support and advanced features (alerts, exports, auditing).
From the Help Center (Support card). You can also report issues including: organization, module, steps to reproduce and a screenshot.
